snippet: Egypt’s justice minister has resigned after raising an uproar by saying in a TV interview that the children of sanitation workers are too lowly to be successful judges.
abstract: Egyptian Justice Min Mahfouz Saber resigns in face of public outcry after saying in TV interview that children of sanitation workers could not succeed as judges.
lead_paragraph: Egypt’s justice minister has resigned after raising an uproar by saying in a TV interview that the children of sanitation workers are too lowly to be successful judges.

headline.main: Egypt: Justice Chief Quits Amid Uproar
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Egypt: Justice Minister Steps Down
